translation.en: [narrator in English] I'm going to tell you a story.
But I'll be honest, it doesn't have a happy ending.
translation.ja: １９８５年 グアダラハラ １９８５年 グアダラハラ 正直言って 幸せな結末じゃない

translation.en: In fact, it doesn't have an ending at all.
translation.ja: いや 結末など存在しない

translation.en: It's about how a bunch of institutions, some you're supposed to trust,
translation.ja: 信頼できると思われた 数多くの政府機関が

translation.en: got together and started a war.
Not the kind of war you're thinking of...
translation.ja: 戦車や戦闘機で攻撃して―

translation.en: the kind with tanks and planes and parades and shit.
translation.ja: 軍事パレードをする 戦争とは違う

translation.en: I'm talking about a drug war.
The kind that's easy to forget is happening...
translation.ja: メキシコでは30年前から―

translation.en: until you realize in the last 30 years in Mexico
translation.ja: この凄惨(せいさん)な抗争が続いている

translation.en: it's killed half a million people...
...and counting.
Now, a lot of people don't want to hear this story.
translation.ja: 人々はこの話題を 避けようとする

translation.en: They want to pretend it never happened.
translation.ja: 目を背けていたいのだ

translation.en: But fuck that.
It happened.
Look, I can't tell you how the drug war ends.
translation.ja: どんな結末になるのかも―

translation.en: Man, I can't even tell you if it ends.
translation.ja: 終わるかどうかも言えない

translation.en: But I can tell you how it began.
Or at least when we realized we were in it.
translation.ja: 我々が気づいた時のことを

translation.en: Sometimes you need somebody to wake you the fuck up
translation.ja: 先に目覚めた者が 周りを叩き起こす

translation.en: and tell you the shooting has started.
In this story...
that guy's name is Kiki Camarena.
translation.ja: それはキキ･カマレナだった

translation.en: Do you smoke pot?
I guess it's okay if you do. There are laws now that say it's cool.
translation.ja: 吸ったっていい 合法な場所もある 合法な場所もある 〝合法マリファナ店〞

translation.en: I don't agree with them. But it's not up to me.
translation.ja: 〝マリファナ〞 俺は反対だが 決めるのは他の人間だ 俺は反対だが 決めるのは他の人間だ

translation.en: They say it's a gateway drug. And it is.
translation.ja: 依存症のきっかけに なり得るのは―

translation.en: It sure is in this story.
If you smoked pot in the late '70s, whether you know it or not,
translation.ja: 1970年代後半に 吸ってたなら―

translation.en: that pot probably started life in the same place our story begins...
translation.ja: この物語が始まる場所と 生産地は同じだ この物語が始まる場所と 生産地は同じだ 〝チワワ　ドゥランゴ シナロア〞

translation.en: Sinaloa.
translation.ja: 〝チワワ　ドゥランゴ シナロア〞 シナロア 〝チワワ　ドゥランゴ シナロア〞

translation.en: The third leg of what they call the Mexican Golden Triangle,
translation.ja: 〝チワワ　ドゥランゴ シナロア〞 メキシコ 黄金の三角地帯の 一角を成す

translation.en: the birthplace of Mexican dope smuggling, and the guys who would go on to run the game.
translation.ja: この国の麻薬密売人による 商売が始まった場所だ

translation.en: With its fertile fields and hills heavy with opium poppies and Mexican marijuana,
translation.ja: 肥沃(ひよく)な土地で栽培される 大量のケシと大麻

translation.en: to potheads and the Sinaloan scumbags who operated there,
translation.ja: 麻薬常習者と シナロアの悪党にとって

translation.en: it was a regular Garden of Eden.
translation.ja: そこは“エデンの園”だった

translation.en: [man in Spanish] Over there.
How's it going? [laughs]
How are things in the land of the future? [laughs]
Laugh now, but the future finds us all, even here in Sinaloa.
translation.ja: 〈見てろ〉 〈シナロアにも未来はある〉

translation.en: Look, she's my new student. This is the real future.
translation.ja: 〈新しい生徒だ この子こそ未来さ〉

translation.en: Watch this.
Okay, princess. Is this ready to harvest?
translation.ja: 〈お姫様 もう収穫しても？〉

translation.en: No, it's not ripe yet.
-At least another week. -What do you say?
She's right.
He was my student. But can you believe he plays with weeds in greenhouses now?
translation.ja: 〈私の生徒だったが 今は温室で大麻を育ててる〉

translation.en: Like some florist. [chuckles]
[woman] Hey, you're gonna be late!
-Go on. -Go on, princess.
-You heard her. -Come on.
-Yes, sir. -One more week before picking.
So, what brings you here? Did you come out for some fresh air?
translation.ja: 〈何しに来た？〉 〈気分転換したくなったか〉

translation.en: My new crops need some air.
I was hoping to borrow an exhaust fan.
Go, Rafa!
Andrea!
[man] Tell them to ring the bell!
[narrator in English] But nothing golden can stay, man.
translation.ja: どんな輝きも永遠ではない

translation.en: When the government in Mexico City figured out
translation.ja: 農民が麻薬栽培で 大金を稼いでいるのを

translation.en: that a bunch of Sinaloan farmers were getting rich shipping their dope up north,
translation.ja: 農民が麻薬栽培で 大金を稼いでいるのを メキシコ政府が把握して 措置を講じた

translation.en: they decided to do something about it.
translation.ja: メキシコ政府が把握して 措置を講じた

translation.en: They called it Operation Condor.
translation.ja: コードネームは “コンドル作戦”

translation.en: It was the code name for the government's invasion of Sinaloa...
translation.ja: 政府が軍事的に介入して―

translation.en: a search and destroy mission designed to turn the drug trade into ashes.
translation.ja: 麻薬密売を一掃するため 撲滅作戦を行う

translation.en: The army's goal was to burn every field they could find, arrest every trafficker,
translation.ja: 軍の使命は 麻薬畑を焼き払って― 密売人を逮捕し 誰がボスか知らしめること

translation.en: and remind the people living there who was boss.
translation.ja: 密売人を逮捕し 誰がボスか知らしめること

translation.en: [priest in Spanish] Carefully! Carefully!
WELCOME TO BADIRAGUATO
translation.ja: “ようこそ バディラグアトへ”

translation.en: We are the national army.
We're here to liberate you from the traffickers of Sinaloa
translation.ja: 〈密売人から 市民を解放しに来た〉

translation.en: who have defied the federal government for too long.
translation.ja: 〈長年 政府に 抵抗してきた悪党め〉

translation.en: Come out with your hands in the air, or we will enter by force.
translation.ja: 〈両手を上げて出てこい さもないと突入する〉

translation.en: -[priest] Go out there, Rafa! -[Rafa] They'll kill me if I do.
translation.ja: 〈外に出ろ　ラファ〉 〈殺される〉

translation.en: They'll kill us all if you don't.
[commander] I want you to shoot the door on my signal.
I just want them to know we're here. Okay?
Good job, Comandante.
I'll get him out. The man you want is Rafa Quintero.
translation.ja: 〈ラファ･キンテロを 確保する〉

translation.en: [commander] Hold up! Who the fuck are you?
-Who am I? -Yes. Who are you?
Miguel Ángel Félix Gallardo. Sinaloa State Police. At your service.
translation.ja: 〈ミゲル･Ａ(アンヘル)･フェリクス･ ガジャルド〉 〈シナロア州警察から 応援に来た〉

translation.en: Do you not realize we're in the middle of an operation?
Come on, Comandante. It's a church.
There's children in there. There's women.
No need for such a big fuss to get one man, right?
translation.ja: 〈敵は１人だ 大騒ぎしなくても〉

translation.en: Let me get him out. Everyone here knows me. Wait.
translation.ja: 〈俺の地元だ　任せてくれ〉

translation.en: [Félix] Father, I'm coming in.
If he's not out in 30 seconds, I want everyone to start shooting.
translation.ja: 〈いいか〉 〈30秒で出てこなければ 銃撃開始だ〉

translation.en: [Félix] There you go, fucker.
There you have him... Rafael Caro Quintero.
translation.ja: 〈確保した〉 〈ラファエル･カロ･ キンテロ〉

translation.en: An illiterate moron who works for Pedro Avilés,
translation.ja: 〈シナロア最大の 密売人である―〉

translation.en: the biggest drug dealer in Sinaloa.
translation.ja: 〈ペドロ･アビレスの 手下だ〉

translation.en: The government has sent the army, man.
Now you're really fucked.
Tell the gentleman here the location of the fields they haven't burned.
translation.ja: 〈まだ焼かれてない畑は どこにある？〉

translation.en: I don't know what the fuck you're talking about-- [grunts]
-[Félix] Let's try that again. -[Rafa groans]
Where the fuck are the fields they haven't burned?
-I don't know! -[grunts]
Pay attention, moron.
Where are the Tameapa fields they haven't burned?
translation.ja: 〈タメアパで 残ってる畑は？〉

translation.en: Up there, sir! Up there!
translation.ja: 〈あっちだ〉 〈川の２キロ先にある 丘の反対側だ〉

translation.en: On the other side of the hill, two kilometers past the river. [coughs]
translation.ja: 〈川の２キロ先にある 丘の反対側だ〉

translation.en: Never met a Sinaloan cop like you.
translation.ja: 〈あんたみたいな警官は 初めてだ〉

translation.en: -What do you say? Can I take him? -Of course.
translation.ja: 〈俺が連行しても？〉 〈もちろんだ〉

translation.en: We still have a lot more fields to burn.
Gentlemen! Let's go!
There! Hey! Stay calm.
[Rafa] Look at what these fucking assholes have done.
Be quiet.
Don't get out.
Hey, it's me. I'm going to open the door.
-[boy] Dad! -How's it going, son? Are you okay?
translation.ja: 〈パパ〉 〈みんな 無事だったか？〉

translation.en: We heard them ripping the place apart.
They came back.
translation.ja: 〈まるで あなたが 計画したように―〉

translation.en: Just like you said they would, as if it was part of your plan.
translation.ja: 〈まるで あなたが 計画したように―〉 〈本当に奴らは戻ってきた〉

translation.en: Predicting is not planning.
You all right?
Did you protect your mom?
We tried, but we were scared.
translation.ja: 〈守りたかったけど すごく怖くて〉

translation.en: Hey, you don't have to be afraid.
-[girl] Okay. -[Félix] All right.
Uncle!
Sweetie.
You didn't stay in the car.
The cuffs hurt, they're cutting off my circulation.
You see what they did to my greenhouse?
They didn't take all of it.
[Rafa] That should be enough.
I always said you were the brains in this house, Maria.
translation.ja: 〈やっぱり 君は この家で一番賢い〉

translation.en: -[Rafa laughs] -Get inside. They're gonna see you.
-Kids, go inside with him! -[grunts]
Go on, go with your uncle.
-You hit me really hard, asshole. -Don't be a crybaby.
translation.ja: 〈本気で殴りやがった〉 〈また泣きごとか〉

translation.en: I considered letting them take all of it... Buy ourselves a couple of months.
translation.ja: 〈奴らにすべて奪わせれば もう少し ここにいられた〉

translation.en: No.
If we don't do it now, nothing is going to change.
translation.ja: 〈今 やらなければ 何も変わらない〉

translation.en: I know.
But I've already told you...
if you want me to stop, I'll stop.
translation.ja: 〈君がイヤなら やめてもいい〉

translation.en: That's why I could never ask you to.
translation.ja: 〈だから今まで 止めなかった〉

translation.en: That was also part of your plan, you bastard.
All right.
[narrator] Military intervention never works the way you want it to.
translation.ja: 軍の介入は 思惑どおりにいかない

translation.en: In fact, it usually backfires.
translation.ja: 大抵の場合は裏目に出る

translation.en: Drug dealers are like cockroaches. You can poison them, step on them...
translation.ja: 密売人はまるでゴキブリだ 毒を食わせても 踏みつけても

translation.en: fuck, you can set them on fire, but they'll always come back...
translation.ja: 火をつけて焼き払っても― 前よりも強くなって よみがえる

translation.en: usually stronger than ever.
translation.ja: 前よりも強くなって よみがえる

translation.en: Any time you think you've knocked out the dope business,
translation.ja: 壊滅させたと思っても―

translation.en: a smart trafficker, well, he'll just find a better way.
translation.ja: 賢い密売人は もっといい方法を探す

translation.en: [man in Spanish] Half the state is still smoldering.
translation.ja: 〈州の半分が 火の海でも―〉

translation.en: Mexico City's never cared about us.
They only care about showing the Americans they can control the marijuana business.
translation.ja: 〈麻薬密売の規制に 成功してると―〉 〈アメリカに示すのに 必死だ〉

translation.en: Yes.
But with crisis... comes opportunity. Right?
translation.ja: 〈だが 危機は チャンスを招くと―〉

translation.en: -You taught me that, Governor. -And risk.
translation.ja: 〈あなたに教わった〉 〈リスクも伴う〉

translation.en: I taught you that too.
I came to thank you for everything you've done for my family.
translation.ja: 〈家族への援助に 感謝します　知事〉

translation.en: You had as much to do with raising Rodolfo as I did.
translation.ja: 〈うちの息子も 君の世話になった〉

translation.en: Could've had a real career in law enforcement, Miguel.
translation.ja: 〈君なら州警察で 出世できた　ミゲル〉

translation.en: Head of state police, if you wanted.
translation.ja: 〈君が望めば 署長になって―〉

translation.en: Might've even changed things around here.
Maybe, right? [chuckles]
But no... you never wanted to change things. -Never aimed higher, right? -[chuckles]
translation.ja: 〈あなたは変化を望まず 野望も抱かなかった〉

translation.en: A Sinaloan president?
No.
You have to make a lot of noise to change things.
translation.ja: 〈何かを変えれば モメ事が起きる〉

translation.en: I'm not one for noise.
I'll tell Rodolfo you came by.
-He'll be sorry he missed you. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 〈会えずに残念がるだろう〉 〈どうも〉

translation.en: Whatever you're planning, be careful.
translation.ja: 〈何をする気か知らんが 用心しろ〉

translation.en: Yes.
All right, Governor.
[in English] It's like four o'clock in the morning, right?
translation.ja: カリフォルニア州 フレズノ 朝の４時頃だった カリフォルニア州 フレズノ

translation.en: And I'm coming up from Long Beach with a bunch of vatos.
translation.ja: カリフォルニア州 フレズノ ロングビーチから 車を走らせてた ロングビーチから 車を走らせてた

translation.en: Then all of a sudden...
Fucking shit, bro. Fuck.
translation.ja: “こりゃ ヤバい”と思った

translation.en: I get pulled over and this dude is just eyeing me, right?
translation.ja: 車を脇に寄せるとサツが来て こう言いやがった

translation.en: And I'm looking at him back and he's like, "Can I get your driver's license?"
translation.ja: 車を脇に寄せるとサツが来て こう言いやがった “免許証を” ２キロのブツが トランクに入ってるんだ

translation.en: I got five pounds in the trunk and he's fucking gonna stop me for a fucking taillight?
translation.ja: ２キロのブツが トランクに入ってるんだ

translation.en: So, anyway, I look over my shoulder, and my boy Diaz, you know, he's like this.
translation.ja: 後ろを見ると 相棒のディアスが― こんなふうに ドア越しに銃を構えてた

translation.en: He's got the gun pinned against the door, right? Oof. He's not gonna go back.
translation.ja: こんなふうに ドア越しに銃を構えてた “トランクを開けろ”と サツに言われたら―

translation.en: If this guy asks me to pop the trunk, I'm gonna blow his fucking head off.
translation.ja: “トランクを開けろ”と サツに言われたら― 頭をブチ抜く気だ

translation.en: But all of a sudden, there's... [imitates static]
Fucking radio chirps. "Robbery in progress. Blah, blah, blah."
translation.ja: 無線が入った “強盗事件が発生”

translation.en: He comes back and he looks at me and he says, "Hey, you know what?
translation.ja: サツは戻ってきて言った “今日のお前はツイてる”

translation.en: It's your lucky day. Fix that fucking taillight."
translation.ja: “今日のお前はツイてる” “テールランプを直せ”

translation.en: And I'm thinking to myself, "My lucky day?"
translation.ja: 心の中で思った “ツイてるのは俺じゃない”

translation.en: [Kiki] Crazy, bro.
Hey, so what's up? We gonna do this?
translation.ja: じゃあ 商売の話を

translation.en: A fucking quarter?
Are you serious?
[man] Sample only. Like what you see, we talk next time. I set you up with more.
translation.ja: サンプルだ 気に入れば次はもっと渡す

translation.en: What I want to see is a hundred.
That's not how I work, vato. Like I said, I'll start you on a sample.
translation.ja: そうはいかない まずサンプルを

translation.en: Something you could've bought off the street, right?
translation.ja: 通りで買ったブツかも

translation.en: If you want to start me off with a sample, you take me to your warehouse,
translation.ja: サンプルだけなら 俺を倉庫に連れていけ

translation.en: you pull out a bale, and I take my sample from that.
translation.ja: そこで包みを選ばせろ

translation.en: -What warehouse? I don't fucking know you. -Chuy's making the fucking introduction!
translation.ja: 誰が知らねえ奴に？ チューイの紹介だ

translation.en: Thought you had this lined up.
translation.ja: バカと話しても時間のムダだ

translation.en: -You're wasting my time with this clown. -Listen to me, puto...
translation.ja: バカと話しても時間のムダだ ふざけるな

translation.en: -He's making the fucking introduction! -Hey! Chill! Chill! Chill!
translation.ja: こっちのセリフだ 落ち着け

translation.en: [Chuy] Yo, he didn't get that shit off the street, man. I can speak for that.
translation.ja: 通りで買ったんじゃない 保証する

translation.en: [Kiki] All right.
I didn't come here for a fucking sample. All right?
translation.ja: サンプルじゃ話にならん

translation.en: I came here for a supplier. Is that gonna be you?
translation.ja: 元締めに会いに来た あんたか？

translation.en: You know what? You're kind of pushy, homes. Yeah?
translation.ja: 押しの強い野郎だな じゃあ 試してみろ

translation.en: So, why don't you take a hit? Chill the fuck out.
translation.ja: じゃあ 試してみろ 頭を冷やせ

translation.en: You know what?
I'm on parole, so I ain't hitting shit.
translation.ja: 俺は仮釈放中だから やめとく

translation.en: You and your little fucking story. What is it? Some kind of cover, puto?
translation.ja: 下手なウソつきやがって 潜入捜査か

translation.en: What, you got your cop buddies listening in right now?
translation.ja: 仲間が盗聴してるのか

translation.en: [in Spanish] Look, motherfucker, I don't like being called a fucking liar.
translation.ja: 〈人をウソつき呼ばわり するな〉

translation.en: And worse...
a fucking cop.
[in English] What's he doing?
-[feedback screeches] -Jesus! Fuck.
[in English] Hey, whoever's listening, they can't hear us right now.
translation.ja: 誰か聞いてるか これで聞こえない

translation.en: -Hey... -No, no, no.
-What the fuck? -Did he just pull out a gun?
translation.ja: 何をしてる？ 銃を抜いた？

translation.en: See that? Point it at my head.
translation.ja: これを見ろ 俺の頭に

translation.en: Point it at me. Point it at me!
-Hey, you're fucking crazy, man. -Go like this.
translation.ja: イカれた野郎だ こうだ

translation.en: Yeah, yeah. There you go.
You'd know what would work better? Like that.
translation.ja: いや こうだ いいぞ

translation.en: -Guys, relax. Give it a second. -Gotta get him out of there. Come on.
translation.ja: 落ち着け 救出に向かう

translation.en: Can't hear a fucking thing!
If I was a fucking cop and I had a gun pointed to my head,
translation.ja: 俺が警官で 銃を突きつけられたら

translation.en: they'd be rushing through that fucking door and blowing you motherfuckers away.
translation.ja: サツが来て お前らを撃ち殺すはずだ

translation.en: Get him the fuck out of there!
[dealer] That was crazy, fucker, eh?
-I told you. -It was funny though.
translation.ja: ほらな 面白い奴だ

translation.en: -[dealer in Spanish] Get him a beer. -[in English] I hear you, bro.
translation.ja: 〈ビールをやれ〉 俺も仮釈放中だ

translation.en: -I'm on parole too. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 俺も仮釈放中だ そうか

translation.en: -It's a bitch, you know? [chuckles] -[Kiki] Fucking bitch, bro.
translation.ja: 厄介だよな ウンザリだ

translation.en: "Pull it, pull it." You're fucking crazy. -I like you, puto. I like you. -[chuckles]
translation.ja: おかしな野郎だな 気に入ったぜ

translation.en: Oh.
Yeah, yo. So, listen.
translation.ja: 飲めよ 同胞よ　段取りはこうだ

translation.en: So, it's like this, homie.
translation.ja: 同胞よ　段取りはこうだ

translation.en: I got a shipment landing next week. -So, once it gets here... -Right.
translation.ja: 来週 ここに ブツが着いたら―

translation.en: ...you come to my spot, and then you can feel all the bales you want, carnal.
translation.ja: 倉庫に来て 好きなだけ持っていけ

translation.en: -[in Spanish] All right. -[man] All right. Cheers.
[in English] I'm gonna take that quarter so my homies can get your... -samples. -[laughs]
translation.ja: このサンプルは 仲間に持って帰る

translation.en: Fresno P.D.!
Fresno P.D.? What the fuck?
Stay down! Turn around! Get the fuck down! Against the wall! Now!
translation.ja: 動くな 壁のほうを向け 待てよ

translation.en: -Shit. -Fuck!
-Hang tight. Can we move in on this? -Fuck!
translation.ja: 落ち着け 介入できるか？

translation.en: -Hey, I'm DEA, all right? -Yeah? And I'm fucking Olivia Newton-John.
translation.ja: 俺はＤＥＡだ 俺はオリビア･ ニュートン･ジョン

translation.en: Shut the fuck up, chico.
Hey, you ever hear of a DEA?
Yeah, it's like... Drug Enforcement Agency or something.
translation.ja: ああ　確か― 麻薬取締部だったかな

translation.en: -Administration. -Yeah.
Chico over here keeps saying he's working undercover for them.
translation.ja: こいつがＤＥＡの捜査官だと

translation.en: Looks like we picked up a whole team of undercovers.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! That's one of my guys.
translation.ja: 待てよ　うちの捜査官だ

translation.en: Shit. Are you serious?
-Yes. -He's with you?
Yeah, that's my partner. And if it wasn't for you guys,
translation.ja: 俺の相棒だ 来週 50キロのブツを 押収できたのに

translation.en: we'd be taking down a hundred fucking pounds next week!
translation.ja: 来週 50キロのブツを 押収できたのに

translation.en: Well, nothing personal, buddy.
Just tough telling the good hombres from the bad sometimes.
translation.ja: 悪党と見分けがつかない

translation.en: No, I get it.
-[grunts] -[all] Oh!
[narrator] Nowadays, you say you're a DEA agent, you're gonna get some respect.
translation.ja: ＤＥＡの捜査官だと言えば 今なら敬意を払われる

translation.en: But back then, people didn't know what to make of them.
translation.ja: だが あの頃は違った

translation.en: They'd only been around for a couple of years.
translation.ja: 設立して まだ数年

translation.en: And compared to our better-known federal agencies, the FBI and the CIA,
translation.ja: ＦＢＩやＣＩＡと違って 知名度が低く―

translation.en: they were nobodies.
In fact, in 1980, there were more women in the NYPD
translation.ja: 1980年代には― ＮＹ市警の女性警官の数より 人員が少なかった

translation.en: than there were agents in the entire DEA.
translation.ja: ＮＹ市警の女性警官の数より 人員が少なかった

translation.en: The headquarters in D.C. sat on top of a fucking strip club.
translation.ja: 本部は ストリップクラブの上だ

translation.en: And even though they didn't need a reminder they came in last
translation.ja: 法執行機関の序列でも ＤＥＡは最下位

translation.en: in the law enforcement pecking order, they got one pretty regularly.
translation.ja: 法執行機関の序列でも ＤＥＡは最下位 それも常にだ

translation.en: [in English] It was a rough one out there.
With all due respect, sir, it was like working with amateurs.
translation.ja: 奴らはまるで素人です

translation.en: Like six months of undercover work down the drain because of those guys.
translation.ja: 半年の潜入捜査が水の泡だ

translation.en: You don't think to inform local law enforcement that you're running an op in their backyard?
translation.ja: 地元警察に 知らせておくべきだろ

translation.en: It was only an introduction. There was no threat.
translation.ja: ただの“自己紹介”で 緊急性はなかった

translation.en: -There was no need for local P.D. -Kiki, you had a gun at your head.
translation.ja: ただの“自己紹介”で 緊急性はなかった 銃を突きつけられた

translation.en: Sir, it-- it's more complicated than that. You read it, sir.
translation.ja: 事情があったんです 報告書にも書いた

translation.en: Fuck it. [sighs]
One more scumbag off the street.
translation.ja: 悪党が通りから減った

translation.en: Um...
Has a decision been made about my transfer, sir?
translation.ja: 俺の異動はどうなりました？

translation.en: Didn't go your way.
All right.
Who did they give Miami to?
Was it Collins?
-O'Brian? -Does it matter?
translation.ja: オブライアン？ 関係ない

translation.en: No, just tell me. I can take it. Just tell me.
translation.ja: 根に持たないから 教えてください

translation.en: Kershaw?
Yeah.
I didn't know he put in for it.
What am I always telling you? Attitude and experience are factors.
translation.ja: いつも言ってる 仕事への熱意と経験で 判断した

translation.en: Kershaw has both.
I got attitude! Want more attitude? I'll give you more attitude.
translation.ja: 俺だって熱意なら負けません

translation.en: Your time will come.
Five years on post here isn't enough, sir?
What other post is available, sir?
What do you have?
-[woman in English] Guadalajara? -That's all that was available.
translation.ja: グアダラハラ？ 他に空きがない

translation.en: If I stay here, my career's just gonna die.
translation.ja: ここで終わりたくない

translation.en: I'm serious. No, no, I mean-- You know what?
translation.ja: いいか　俺は本気だ

translation.en: If you don't move on, you don't move up. That's the way.
translation.ja: 異動しなきゃ上がれない

translation.en: That from the handbook?
What do you want me to say, Kiki?
-It's not Miami. -[scoffs]
Miami. Fucking Kershaw. I swear. It's fucking bullshit.
translation.ja: そうだな カーショウの奴め くたばれ！

translation.en: Dunn's a fucking asshole.
Five years for what?
I'll stop. I'll stop.
-Kikito's about to bat. -All right.
translation.ja: キキートが打つ ああ

translation.en: All right, let's go, Kikito. Just like I said.
Keep your eye on the ball and swing through it, okay? Hey!
translation.ja: ボールから目を離すな いいか

translation.en: Keep it simple. Remember, remember, from the ground up, rotate, release,
translation.ja: 思いきり振るんだ ボールから目を離すな

translation.en: and keep your eye on the ball. Let's go.
translation.ja: ボールから目を離すな

translation.en: [Kiki] That's not how we practiced.
That's your dad's genes at work right there.
translation.ja: 君の父親にそっくりだ

translation.en: -Good contact, Kikito! -Yeah, good contact.
translation.ja: 惜しかったわ よく当てた

translation.en: I mean, we could always move back to Calexico.
translation.ja: キャレキシコに帰ろうか

translation.en: I got a better idea. Why don't you quit? Fuck it. Become a fireman again.
translation.ja: もっといい考えが 退職すれば？ 消防士に戻るのよ

translation.en: No, I can do other things.
I can do other things.
Sure you can, honey.
-[in Spanish] Nervous? -Yes.
It's time.
Yes, it's time.
Time you buy some nice clothes, man.
Hello, Joaquin.
Are you coming in?
No. I'm just the farmer. Meeting him is all you.
translation.ja: 〈いや　俺はただの農民だ〉 〈お前に任せる〉

translation.en: All right.
[man] Don't you fuck with me!
Six fucking months!
We need to replant everything again.
That's the thing. We lost everything, boss.
The entire damn field.
And what were you doing while they burned my fields?
He lost an eye, Pedro.
Yeah, I see that. Thank you for your sacrifice, Hector.
translation.ja: 〈よく犠牲を払ってくれた エクトル〉

translation.en: But the rest of you?
I see a lot of two-eyed motherfuckers in here!
translation.ja: 〈両目があっても 役立たずか〉

translation.en: What the fuck did any of you do?
Go to Durango.
Tell Gomez to sell us whatever he's got.
translation.ja: 〈ゴメスのブツを 買って―〉

translation.en: -It might be enough to hold us over. -Done.
translation.ja: 〈何とか しのぐんだ〉 〈了解です〉

translation.en: [Félix] Excuse me, boss. If you'll allow me...
I have an idea to solve this for good.
translation.ja: 〈根本的に解決するための 提案があります〉

translation.en: Well, fuck. Didn't this guy babysit the governor's kid?
translation.ja: 〈この野郎〉 〈知事のガキの子守なら 攻撃を知ってただろ〉

translation.en: He could've given us a heads-up.
translation.ja: 〈知事のガキの子守なら 攻撃を知ってただろ〉

translation.en: He's the governor of Sinaloa. They don't tell him shit.
With all due respect, boss,
but the army burns our fields, and what do we do?
translation.ja: 〈軍に畑を焼かれてる どうすべきだと？〉

translation.en: We buy Durango weed and hope to stay alive, really? Again?
translation.ja: 〈ドゥランゴの大麻に また頼っても―〉

translation.en: We'll end up the same or even more screwed when they come back.
translation.ja: 〈状況は改善するどころか 悪化する〉

translation.en: We have to take the business somewhere else.
translation.ja: 〈他の土地で やり直すべきだ〉

translation.en: Where they can't touch us. Where they wouldn't even try.
translation.ja: 〈奴らが邪魔する気にも ならない場所〉

translation.en: We have to go to Guadalajara.
We're nobodies there.
We're nobodies here, Don Neto.
The army invades us and what? No fucking journalist writes about it.
translation.ja: 〈軍が介入しても 誰も新聞に書こうとしない〉

translation.en: They do this because we are Sinaloans. We're fucked. Nothing happens here.
translation.ja: 〈シナロアだから 何も問題にならない〉

translation.en: Things are different there.
They have banks, big businesses, fancy people, and all that shit.
translation.ja: 〈銀行やデカい企業が進出し 金持ちも多い〉

translation.en: I'd like to see the government send the army there.
translation.ja: 〈軍を出動させれば 大騒ぎになり―〉

translation.en: It would be a huge mess. Front-page news and shit.
translation.ja: 〈軍を出動させれば 大騒ぎになり―〉 〈新聞の一面に載る〉

translation.en: I say it's the only way. But whatever you say, boss.
translation.ja: 〈他に方法はないが―〉 〈決めるのはボスだ〉

translation.en: What does this fucker know?
He's not a trafficker.
translation.ja: 〈密売人じゃない 警官のくせに〉

translation.en: -He's a cop. -Ex-cop.
Even worse.
Let's see... Guadalajara is still run by the Naranjo brothers.
translation.ja: 〈グアダラハラは ナランホ兄弟の縄張りだ〉

translation.en: Think those fucking animals are gonna let us move into their territory, Pedro?
translation.ja: 〈奴らが俺たちを 受け入れるとでも？〉

translation.en: You are the Lion of Sinaloa. You built all of this.
translation.ja: 〈あんたはシナロアの獅子(ライオン) 麻薬密売の創始者だ〉

translation.en: They'd be fools not to negotiate.
They're going to laugh at us.
No one fucking laughs at me.
Go to Guadalajara. Sit down with them.
translation.ja: 〈グアダラハラへ行って 奴らと話せ〉

translation.en: If you can't make a deal...
it's on you.
Sounds good.
translation.ja: 〈分かりました〉 〈だが 信用を得るには 付き添いが要る〉

translation.en: I just need someone to come with me to lend me credibility.
translation.ja: 〈だが 信用を得るには 付き添いが要る〉

translation.en: He's right about that.
-Who do you have in mind? -Don Neto would do.
translation.ja: 〈誰を考えてる？〉 〈ドン･ネトでいい〉

translation.en: Well, shit. [laughs]
How many more you gonna have?
I don't know. I mean, that's only my sixth one.
translation.ja: さあ どうかな まだ６本目だ

translation.en: I'd have my own, but I wouldn't want her to turn out like you.
translation.ja: 私はやめとく 娘が酒浸りになる

translation.en: -Yeah, nobody wants that. -[chuckles]
Why are you looking at me like that?
I think you know.
I don't.
I don't want to stay in Fresno.
You're tired of the same. I am too.
translation.ja: ２人ともこの街に ウンザリしてる

translation.en: So, let's change it.
Together.
Show them what they're not seeing.
You sure you want that?
Don't you?
Take Mexico, Kiki. Prove them wrong.
translation.ja: メキシコへ行って見返すのよ

translation.en: What about you?
I have to check, but I'm pretty sure women give birth in Mexico too.
translation.ja: 向こうでも 子供は産めるはずよ

translation.en: Right.
[in Spanish] Passports.
Welcome to Mexico.
[in Spanish] I brought those for all of us.
Drink the ones I didn't get to.
You probably feel like hot shit kissing Pedro's ass to back you up.
translation.ja: 〈ペドロに取り入って うまくやった気か〉

translation.en: Let me explain how this shit works.
These guys, the Naranjo brothers, they're the competition.
translation.ja: 〈ナランホ兄弟は 俺たちの商売敵だ〉

translation.en: They don't give a shit about the "Lion of Sinaloa." And they certainly don't give a shit about you.
translation.ja: 〈シナロアの獅子やお前を 助けるはずがない〉

translation.en: I'm treating this like a vacation to Guadalajara.
translation.ja: 〈俺はグアダラハラで 休暇を楽しむ〉

translation.en: I'm gonna have a blast. I'm not part of your plan.
translation.ja: 〈俺はグアダラハラで 休暇を楽しむ〉 〈お前の計画など知らん〉

translation.en: I'll get you a meeting and then I'll sit back and watch you go down.
translation.ja: 〈奴と引き合わせるだけで あとは高みの見物だ〉

translation.en: Got it?
Yeah, got it.
One more thing...
that ass-kissing shit? It cuts both ways.
translation.ja: 〈ボスに媚(こ)びるのは 両刃(もろは)の剣だ〉

translation.en: You embarrass Pedro, make him look weak, he'll blow holes in you.
translation.ja: 〈ペドロをおとしめて 恥をかかせたら―〉 〈頭をブチ抜かれるぞ〉

translation.en: That goes for you too, cupcake.
[Félix] Go ahead.
[Don Neto] What's going on?
Rafa!
Once you finish, go straight to the hotel, okay?
-Okay. -Brother...
this is serious.
Okay.
Is he looking for vocational guidance or what?
translation.ja: 〈就職指導でも 受けるのか？〉

translation.en: SCHOOL OF GEOLOGY
I'm getting a drink.
Yes.
Yes.
Perfect.
Yes, sir. You're welcome.
Do you have two rooms?
How long is your stay?
Well, indefinitely.
[man] Don Neto.
I was surprised to hear you were in town.
It was an unplanned trip.
[Don Neto] Babysitting this one.
How's your brother?
All good.
I heard about the army.
They burned your goods again, right?
Too bad.
But if you want to kill rats, guess you have to go into the sewer.
translation.ja: 〈ネズミを殺すには ドブに入らないと〉

translation.en: -Right? -Yes.
Yes, of course.
Anyway, like I said, I'm here to introduce you to this guy.
translation.ja: 〈こいつを 紹介するために来た〉

translation.en: He's got a proposal for you.
-A proposal? How nice. -Yes.
translation.ja: 〈提案か　大歓迎だ〉 〈よかった〉

translation.en: Let's hear it then.
That mess that took place in Sinaloa...
translation.ja: 〈シナロアの畑は 焼かれたが―〉

translation.en: created an opportunity for both of our organizations.
translation.ja: 〈我々の組織にとって チャンスでもある〉

translation.en: We're looking for a partnership.
-Partnership? -[Félix] Yes.
Well, now I'm interested.
It's very easy.
Basically, we move our growing operation here.
translation.ja: 〈つまり―〉 〈ここに移って 商売することにした〉

translation.en: We move to Guadalajara.
And all we need from you is police protection.
translation.ja: 〈あんたたちにサツから 守ってもらいたい〉

translation.en: Uh-huh.
We take care of everything, the labor, the distribution, all of the costs.
translation.ja: 〈俺たちが全部やる〉 〈生産や流通の費用も すべて持ち―〉

translation.en: And we're willing to split the profits 50/50.
translation.ja: 〈利益はあんたたちと 半分ずつ山分けだ〉

translation.en: Okay.
I mean, we're... we're the best at growing this shit.
translation.ja: 〈俺たちなら 最高の大麻を育てられる〉

translation.en: Well, look at this fucker.
How about we split the profits 60/40?
translation.ja: 〈利益の取り分は ６対４でどうだ？〉

translation.en: Here's my final offer.
You get nothing and get out of my fucking town.
translation.ja: 〈分かったら 俺の街から出ていけ〉

translation.en: Partners?
Is this guy fucking serious?
You guys have a lot of fine pussy in Sinaloa, right?
translation.ja: 〈シナロアには いい女がいるだろ〉

translation.en: Well, since everyone is going to starve, why don't you send us the best you got?
translation.ja: 〈飢え死にしそうなら―〉 〈最高の女を連れてこい〉

translation.en: We'll find work for them here.
Tell the Lion that we're laughing at him in Guadalajara.
translation.ja: 〈ここじゃ“獅子”は いい笑い物だ〉

translation.en: "Partnership."
You know what? I have another proposal.
What the fuck is wrong with you?
Are you fucking crazy?
This place is gonna be filled with cops, their cops, who are gonna take us to his brother to burn us alive.
translation.ja: 〈すぐ警官に連行されて 奴の兄貴に焼き殺される〉

translation.en: Rafa.
Come on.
You're crazy. Fuck you both.
Come on. Show me. Come on, show it to me.
I spoke to the geologist. He said that...
Here.
-Seriously? -[Rafa] It's closer than we thought.
translation.ja: 〈確かか？〉 〈思ったより近い あとは耕すだけだ〉

translation.en: We just have to dig.
translation.ja: 〈思ったより近い あとは耕すだけだ〉

translation.en: Hey... stick to the plan.
[in English] Hi, I'm Kiki Camarena. I'm looking for a Jaime Kuykendall.
translation.ja: カマレナです キューケンドールさんを

translation.en: Mr. Kuykendall is in the back waiting for you.
translation.ja: 奥の部屋でお待ちです

translation.en: Thank you.
[man] Agent Camarena.
-Yes, sir. -Jaime. Jaime Kuykendall.
Nice to meet you.
-Welcome to Guadalajara. -Thank you, sir.
translation.ja: 歓迎するよ どうも

translation.en: Come on back.
[Jaime] So, how was the trip down?
It was a little long, sir.
Having a six-year-old in the back didn't help.
translation.ja: まだ６歳の息子がいるもので

translation.en: But I look forward to getting started.
translation.ja: ここでの仕事が楽しみです

translation.en: I take it you speak Spanish?
[in Spanish] Well, the tan isn't from the sun. I was born this way.
translation.ja: 〈この肌の色は 日焼けじゃない〉 〈生まれつきです〉

translation.en: [in English] Well, how did that play with the boys up in Fresno?
translation.ja: フレズノの捜査官たちとは？

translation.en: Like you might expect, sir.
[in Spanish] My wife is from Chiapas. But we like it better here.
translation.ja: 〈妻はチアパス出身だが―〉 〈我々はこの街を 気に入ってる〉

translation.en: [in English] Yeah, I think you will too.
I mean, the truth is, this office has been needing someone like you.
translation.ja: 君のような人材を求めてた

translation.en: Don't get me wrong. Agents Knapp and Sears, they're strong agents,
translation.ja: ナップとシアーズも 優秀な捜査官だが

translation.en: but ethnicity poses its limitations on the locals here.
translation.ja: 人種が違うと 捜査に限界がある

translation.en: Sure, yeah. No, I'd imagine that the informants probably feel a little safer
translation.ja: メキシコ系の捜査官のほうが 汚職の情報も聞き出しやすい

translation.en: -talking corruption to a fellow Mexican. -So, you get how Mexico works.
translation.ja: メキシコ系の捜査官のほうが 汚職の情報も聞き出しやすい もう分かってるな

translation.en: Uh, well, my grandmother's from Guadalajara
translation.ja: 祖母がここの出身なので よく会いに来た

translation.en: and I used to spend a lot of time here as a kid.
translation.ja: 祖母がここの出身なので よく会いに来た そうか

translation.en: Well, the Mex-Feds are crooked as hell, but they're what we got. You know, we work with them best we can.
translation.ja: 汚職まみれの警官を相手に うまくやるしかない

translation.en: -[chuckles] We try to, anyway. -Right.
translation.ja: とにかく努力はしてる

translation.en: Uh, sir, is there a case that you want me to jump on?
translation.ja: すぐ取りかかれる事件は？

translation.en: It may serve you better to think about this as more of a, uh...
translation.ja: うちの仕事に関しては こう考えたほうがいい

translation.en: a data-gathering assignment rather than a traditional law enforcement posting.
translation.ja: 従来の捜査活動というより 情報収集が中心になる

translation.en: You know, we can't arrest anyone. We don't have that power.
translation.ja: 誰も逮捕できない 権限がないんだ

translation.en: We just gather intelligence best we can, and send it on to the agents up north.
translation.ja: 情報を集めて本国に送るのが 主な任務だ

translation.en: Ah.
Like a neighborhood watch.
We do the best we can.
No, I understand, sir. Sorry. I understand, like, you know--
translation.ja: ええ　分かりました すみません

translation.en: If data gathering is what you do, then, uh, I'm all in, sir.
translation.ja: 情報収集が任務なら 全力で当たります

translation.en: [knocks on desk] Good. All right. So, we hit the Camelot around 5:00.
translation.ja: よし ５時にキャメロットに行くぞ 向かいのバーだ

translation.en: That's the bar across the street. You should join us.
translation.ja: ５時にキャメロットに行くぞ 向かいのバーだ

translation.en: I mean, you've seen the desert. It's time to meet the snakes.
translation.ja: 砂漠に來たなら― ヘビに会え

translation.en: [in Spanish] Federal Security Directorate! On your feet!
I want to see your hands! Hands!
Hello.
Don't do anything stupid.
Search them.
Let's go.
We found this fat fuck leaving town.
translation.ja: 〈このデブが 逃げようとしてた〉

translation.en: I'm dead thanks to you, asshole.
Let's go. Stop talking. Let's go.
I'm a cop, too.
At least I was.
State police.
I used to patrol the fields at night back in Sinaloa.
translation.ja: 〈シナロアで夜中に 畑の見回りを〉

translation.en: One night, I found a man clipping buds from the stalks back in the fields.
translation.ja: 〈ある夜―〉 〈花穂(バッズ)を摘んでる男を 捕まえた〉

translation.en: Poor bastard.
Stealing from men who don't know how to forgive...
translation.ja: 〈奴が盗んだ畑の 持ち主は―〉

translation.en: just like you.
They asked me to kill him and "make him disappear."
translation.ja: 〈“奴を始末しろ”と 言われた〉

translation.en: Do you know what I did?
I drove him out to the edge of the desert...
translation.ja: 〈砂漠の果てまで 連れていき―〉

translation.en: I pulled him out of the car, and told him to run.
translation.ja: 〈車から降ろして こう言った〉

translation.en: I told him to go straight until the sun rose.
translation.ja: 〈“夜が明けるまで 走って逃げろ”〉

translation.en: That man... was the brother of a cop.
He was just starting out. They called him "El Azul."
translation.ja: 〈新人警官だった頃の “エル･アスール”〉

translation.en: But I think you call him something else, no?
translation.ja: 〈あんたたちは 別の名で呼んでる〉

translation.en: I think you call him "Comandante."
Take me to him.
Or we'll see if you don't end up just like me.
[Knapp in English] We got two whiskeys, three Cuba libres, and cinco cervezas.
translation.ja: ウイスキー２つと ラムコーク３つ 〈ビール５本〉

translation.en: So, you just buy them drinks all night and hope they give you something?
translation.ja: 酒をおごって 情報を聞き出す？

translation.en: Drunker they get, the more they spill.
Look, nobody talks more shit than a drunk Mexican cop.
translation.ja: 酔ったメキシコ人ほど おしゃべりな奴はいない

translation.en: [in Spanish] You're new here, right?
Just got here.
Welcome to Guadalajara.
On duty?
Everyone here is on duty. Look.
-Kiki Camarena. -Sammy Álvarez.
translation.ja: 〈キキ･カマレナだ〉 〈サミー･アルバレス〉

translation.en: -These guys all cops? -Yeah.
The ones in uniform are the Guadalajara municipal cops.
translation.ja: 〈制服を着てるのは グアダラハラ市警〉

translation.en: In other words, local shit.
The ones in blue are from the Jalisco State Police.
The one over here is my captain.
And the judicial police?
The two tables in the back, the federales.
The one talking to your boss, that's Comandante Rojas.
translation.ja: 〈君のボスの話し相手が ロハス司令官〉

translation.en: And the one next to him is Comandante Mendez.
You guys like to buy drinks, eh?
That's the American way.
-Do you want one? -Sure, I'll take the same.
[Tomás in Spanish] Comandante.
Comandante.
Good evening, everyone.
-Good evening. -Good evening.
Tomás.
Who are your friends?
This is the guy who saved your brother's life back in Sinaloa.
translation.ja: 〈ボスの弟の命を 救ったそうで〉

translation.en: Thought you'd want to talk to him before we kill him, boss.
translation.ja: 〈始末する前に 話したいかと〉

translation.en: What a good idea.
Except I don't have a brother, you fucking idiot.
translation.ja: 〈だが俺には弟はいない このバカめ〉

translation.en: We have a proposal.
This is their deal, I'm not with them. Just to make it clear.
translation.ja: 〈こいつらの考えだ〉 〈断っておくが 俺は関係ない〉

translation.en: Yeah, they told me you had a proposal.
I heard you had a meeting with Hernin Naranjo. And it didn't go well.
translation.ja: 〈ナランホと会ったが 交渉は決裂か〉

translation.en: My deal is only for you. It was never for the Naranjos.
translation.ja: 〈交渉相手はあんただ 奴らじゃない〉

translation.en: My offer is in that bag.
translation.ja: 〈俺の提案は リュックの中にある〉

translation.en: It's our new strain. It's much stronger than the shit you have here.
translation.ja: 〈これは新種で―〉 〈ここのブツより良質だ〉

translation.en: Jesus! Give me one of our kilos.
translation.ja: 〈ヘスス〉 〈うちのを持ってこい〉

translation.en: They both weigh the same. How?
Tell him, bro.
Well, I eliminated the male parts.
They were pollinating the female parts so... now there's no seeds.
translation.ja: 〈雄株は授粉するが… これは種がない〉

translation.en: Your dope's filled with stems, seeds, shit you can't smoke.
translation.ja: 〈そっちは茎や種が混じって とても吸う気になれない〉

translation.en: Ours takes up less space.
So, we can transport much more using the same number of trucks.
I'm looking for a partner. I'm offering 50 percent. What do you think?
translation.ja: 〈パートナーとして 取り分は半々でどうです？〉

translation.en: -So, what do you call this? -What do we call it?
Seedless.
[Hernin] Where are the fuckers?
These are the fuckers who killed my brother.
-Calm down. -No, fuck that!
translation.ja: 〈落ち着け〉 〈なぜ まだ生かしてる？〉

translation.en: You wanna tell me why this fucker is still breathing?
These sons of bitches die right now!
[El Azul] Put the gun down.
Down.
This fucker just killed my brother!
You'll have to excuse me.
But I've gotta look after my partners.
Go get them! Tomás, take care of it.
translation.ja: 〈捕まえろ〉 〈トマス　任せたぞ〉

translation.en: And you...
Didn't you say you aren't with them?
Wait, wait, wait. He's with us.
translation.ja: 〈待ってくれ　彼も仲間だ〉

translation.en: -It was just a joke. -Yeah.
-[two gunshots from a distance] -Yeah. He just plays hard to get.
That's good.
I want my money every month.
I figure it'll take a little while... for it to grow.
translation.ja: 〈だが育つまで 少し時間が必要だな〉

translation.en: Yeah.
All right.
First month is courtesy of the Naranjos.
translation.ja: 〈ナランホに免じて 最初の月は要らん〉

translation.en: It's a pleasure.
[in Spanish] My uncle is from the Jalisco State Police.
translation.ja: 〈おじはハリスコ州警察の 警官だ〉

translation.en: One day, he calls me, tells me to go to his house and bring money.
translation.ja: 〈ある日 家に金を 持ってこいと言われた〉

translation.en: He starts to count it. Bah, bah, bah.
translation.ja: 〈おじは金を 数え始めて―〉

translation.en: All of a sudden... he says that I am now a cop too.
translation.ja: 〈突然 俺に言った〉 〈“今日から お前も警官だ”と〉

translation.en: I guess I was helping someone get out of trouble,
translation.ja: 〈俺は誰か困ってる奴を 助けた代わりに―〉

translation.en: and in exchange, he got me a job.
At least you have a job, right?
He takes ten percent of what I make.
-What a nice guy, your uncle. -[chuckles]
-Who are they? -[Jaime in English] The boogeyman.
[in Spanish] Three whiskies.
[Sammy in English] Thank you.
[in English] Those boys are DFS.
Federal Security Directorate.
They're kind of like the KGB and the Gestapo all rolled into one.
translation.ja: ＫＧＢとゲシュタポを 合わせたようなものだ

translation.en: -Guess we're not buying them drinks. -No.
translation.ja: 酒はおごらない 彼らにはＣＩＡがおごる

translation.en: No, they get theirs from the CIA.
Yeah. We steer clear of them, they do the same for us. That's just kind of the deal.
translation.ja: うちとは互いに距離を置く それが暗黙の了解だ

translation.en: Right. No, I get it.
translation.ja: なるほど 分かりました 俺たちは部外者

translation.en: Not our ballgame. We just provide the refreshments.
translation.ja: 分かりました 俺たちは部外者 出すとしても お茶だ

translation.en: You learn quick.
[in Spanish] Hey, could you hand me one?
Sure.
Thank you.
You've got blood on your shoes.
[in Spanish] This is it.
It's a desert.
But there's a lot of water underneath.
Enough to grow all the dope that the U.S. smokes in a year.
translation.ja: 〈アメリカ人が１年吸える 大麻が育つ〉

translation.en: You learn that in college?
[chuckles] Hey.
That true? What he said back there? He created that shit?
Yes. It's his baby.
Well, then he's a genius!
That's why you brought him.
We're starting to understand each other, Don Neto.
If you guys had that magic weed, why not plant it back home?
translation.ja: 〈なぜ魔法の大麻を 故郷で植えなかった？〉

translation.en: It can't be done. It can't grow near any other dope.
translation.ja: 〈それは無理だ〉 〈別のハッパの近くだと 他花受粉してしまう〉

translation.en: It would get cross pollinated.
translation.ja: 〈別のハッパの近くだと 他花受粉してしまう〉

translation.en: For these bitches to grow... they have to be alone.
translation.ja: 〈単独で育てる必要が あるんだ〉

translation.en: And Avilés?
What's he going to think about all of this?
I don't know. What do you think?
Being the biggest drug lord in Mexico?
translation.ja: 〈メキシコ最大の 密売人になる〉

translation.en: I think he'll like it.
He comes off as that type of guy. [scoffs]
And why me?
I've got a plan.
[chuckles] I don't doubt it.
Either way, you're still fucking crazy.
translation.ja: 〈どっちにしても イカれてる〉

translation.en: But maybe you know more about this business than I thought.
translation.ja: 〈だが思ったより この商売を知ってる〉

translation.en: No, I'm not interested in your business.
What I'm doing here... is building an empire.
translation.ja: 〈俺はここに 帝国を築くんだ〉
